ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: French translation, reading
I have become more skilled at reading French by recognizing the typical grammar, sentence structure, idioms, and conjugations/tenses of the language.
I learned how to better read French
I developed a working knowledge of French for reading, and by the end felt comfortable grasping both the basic and technical significance of the passages we read.
I learned to read French texts more quickly and fluently.
To translate french.
Ability to read French fairly well, considering the time spent.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It was a good pace! Definitely fast, but I felt the schedule they have us was doable.

Strengths: relaxed tone, well-structured format, organic pace, excellent feedback
Weaknesses: some typos in the lecture slides/assessments
Improvements: could benefit from adding some "master" lists/charts of conjugation endings, idioms, etc. to the Canvas files page for easy access
Lecture videos were often very concise and helpful, as was the feedback to translation exercises. However, the course sometimes moved too quickly
The TAs were absolutely excellent.

Biggest weakness was the textbook, which I found not very useful. This textbook does not present information in an organized, clear way, but relies on rote learning. The book was also difficult to acquire at a reasonable price. In the end, I bought a supplemental French for Reading textbook, which I used predominantly to learn the course material. Strength of the course was the feedback on translation assignments, which was consistently thorough and helpful.
I thought the textbook was very weak and the translation exercises were outdated and often obscure. The video lessons were good!

The course sort of is what it is, I think. It's an online course that keeps you honest about reading and translating French enough that you gain working knowledge of it. It was identical in structure to the German for reading class, so I doubt any major structural changes are in the future for it either way. Obviously, many students were unhappy with certain passages in the textbook, but personally I found it to be valuable preparation for reading primary sources.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would! It's a useful class, and although the textbook is quite outdated in terms of material. it was very easy to follow along.
Yes, it does exactly what it intends to do.
Yes. The course was very effective for learning the basics of reading french
Not if the course is online.
Yes if they would like to learn to translate french. If they want a greater understanding of the whole language they should take an introductory course.
Yes, I'd recommend this to other students looking to gain a working familiarity with french in a short amount of time.
yes
